intro: Lasiospermum radiatum, commonly known as the radiant hair-vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often covered with fine, hairy textures. The flowers emit a mild fragrance, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
